data.why:
A pause function for win32. A perl script can be invoked in 1 of 5
    ways on a Windows 98 SE machine. (I can't speak for other Win32
    systems.) When a script is invoked by Clicking on a perl script file
    icon or within the Start-Run dialog box, the script runs in a DOS
    windows which closes as soon as the script terminates. The user does
    not have sufficient time to view any output. The pause function
    halts the script until the user presses a key. The pause function
    has no effect if the script is invoked from the command line or a
    browser (cgi-bin or mod_perl).
